name: Torvar

aspects.high_concept: Boisterous Axe-Brother of the Mead Hall
other_aspects: Loyal to the Hall Over Everything
Laughs at Pain, Until It's Personal
Hates the Silver Hand With a Hot, Dumb Passion
A Good Heart Buried Under Loudness

stunts: Brawler's Momentum: +2 to Fight if Torvar created an advantage this scene using Physique (grapples, shoves, breaking lines).
Mead Hall Roar (Once/session): Use Provoke to Create an Advantage 'Shaken' on a group in his zone (opposed by Will).
Hold the Line: +2 to Fight when defending a chokepoint or doorway.
notes: Torvar is a classic hall-warrior: loud, brave, and prone to turning a plan into a brawl. Underneath the noise, he's fiercely loyal. His growth arc is learning to be useful beyond being a hammer: scouting, restraint, and leadership when the Hall needs discipline.

relationships.Kodlak Whitemane: Respects him; doesn't always understand his patience.
relationships.Farkas: Gets along well; sees him as 'the reliable one.'
relationships.Vilkas: Feels judged by him; tries to impress him via bravado.
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Half terrified, half infatuated with her ferocity.
relationships.Elitrof Whitemane: Wants to be his 'right-hand brawler'; accepts leadership when framed as 'Hall Law.'

personality_notes.speaking_style: Loud, joking, simple phrasing; gets serious instantly when someone bleeds.
fears: Losing his brothers and being unable to stop it
quirks: Collects trophies he can't explain later

romance_arc.conflict: He fears he's 'just the loud guy' next to legends. Needs reassurance through deeds.

recruitment.greeting: Going out? Finally. Let's make it memorable.

story_hooks: Torvar's bond quest starts when he learns Silver Hand are funded by a local patron.
He can be the first to volunteer for 'dangerous distraction' roles.
He becomes a morale engine in civil-war battles if trained into discipline.
